intro: Allium toksanbaicum, commonly known as the Toksan garlic, is a perennial bulbous plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant produces bulbous structures similar to garlic, which are used in traditional medicine and cuisine. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
